page.title: 15WORSHIP IN SHERIFF HUTTON
page.content: There are two churches,Anglican and Methodist,who work closely together and share some services throughout the year.Services are held morning and evening each Sunday at both churches, also Sunday schools during the morning services.The 11+ children have a separate Sunday group and there is a church creche.There are numerous church groups,some ecumenical and others not,meeting weekly or fortnightly.On Friday evenings during term time the Christian Youth Group meets in the old chapel schoolroom. Activities are organised,also trips to various places i.e.swimming,ice skating,fire station,pantomime.All members are expected to attend Sunday worship.The modern Anglican vicarage is in the village but the methodist minister lives 4 miles away,and has several other churches under his care.
